 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַלָּח‎</span>] **noun masculine** ==mariner== (loan-word from Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***mala—u***</u></abbr> [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>HWB 412</sup> compare Id<sup>[[Prov.1|Prov 1]].178</sup>; [[BDB#Hal|Hal]]<sup>ZA iv. 1880, 53</sup>; so also Aramaic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> (see [[BDB#Brock|Brock]].), whence Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> [[BDB#Frä|Frä]]<sup>221</sup>); — plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַלָּחִים‎</span> [[Jonah.1.5|Jonah 1:5]]; [[Ezek.27.29|Ezek 27:29]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַלָּחַיִךְ‎</span> [[Ezek.27.27|Ezek 27:27]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַלָּחֵיהֶם‎</span> v[[Ezek.27.9|Ezek 27:9]] ([[BDB#Ba|Ba]]<sup>NB 49 Anm. 3</sup>); — ***mariners, sailors*** of ship going to Tarshish [[Jonah.1.5|Jonah 1:5]] (compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רַב הַחֹבֵל‎</span> v[[Jonah.1.6|Jonah 1:6]]); to Tyre [[Ezek.27.9|Ezek 27:9]], compare v[[Ezek.27.27|Ezek 27:27]] v[[Ezek.27.29|Ezek 27:29]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֹבְלִים‎</span>). <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִלְחָמָה‎</span> see  I. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לחם‎</span>.
